texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I used to be one of those folks who would install Fedora, CentOS, Scientific Linux, or Red Hat and disable SELinux during the installation. It always seemed like SELinux would get in my way and keep me from getting work done.
texts.text: I used to be one of those folks who would install Fedora, CentOS, Scientific Linux, or Red Hat and disable SELinux during the installation. It always seemed like SELinux would get in my way and keep me from getting work done.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Later on, I found that one of my servers (which I'd previously secured quite thoroughly) had some rogue processes running that were spawned through httpd. Had I actually been using SELinux in enforcing mode, those processes would have probably never even started.
texts.text: Later on, I found that one of my servers (which I'd previously secured quite thoroughly) had some rogue processes running that were spawned through httpd. Had I actually been using SELinux in enforcing mode, those processes would have probably never even started.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you're trying to get started with SELinux but you're not sure how to do it without completely disrupting your server's workflow, these tips should help:
texts.text: If you're trying to get started with SELinux but you're not sure how to do it without completely disrupting your server's workflow, these tips should help:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Get some good reporting and monitoring
texts.text: Get some good reporting and monitoring

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Two of the most handy SELinux tools are  setroubleshoot and setroubleshoot-server . If you're running a server without X, you can use  my guide for configuring setroubleshoot-server . You will receive email alerts within seconds of an AVC denial and the emails should contain tips on how to resolve the denial if the original action should be allowed. If the AVC denial caught something you didn't expect, you'll know about the potential security breach almost immediately.
texts.text: Two of the most handy SELinux tools are  setroubleshoot and setroubleshoot-server . If you're running a server without X, you can use  my guide for configuring setroubleshoot-server . You will receive email alerts within seconds of an AVC denial and the emails should contain tips on how to resolve the denial if the original action should be allowed. If the AVC denial caught something you didn't expect, you'll know about the potential security breach almost immediately.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Start out with SELinux in permissive mode
texts.text: Start out with SELinux in permissive mode

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you're overly concerned about SELinux getting in your way, or if you're enabling SELinux on a server that has been running without SELinux since it was installed, start out with SELinux in permissive mode. To make the change effective immediately, just run:
texts.text: If you're overly concerned about SELinux getting in your way, or if you're enabling SELinux on a server that has been running without SELinux since it was installed, start out with SELinux in permissive mode. To make the change effective immediately, just run:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: to make it persistent across reboots:
texts.text: to make it persistent across reboots:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# This file controls the state of SELinux on the system.
# SELINUX= can take one of these three values:
#     enforcing - SELinux security policy is enforced.
#     permissive - SELinux prints warnings instead of enforcing.
#     disabled - No SELinux policy is loaded.
SELINUX=permissive
texts.text:
# This file controls the state of SELinux on the system.
# SELINUX= can take one of these three values:
#     enforcing - SELinux security policy is enforced.
#     permissive - SELinux prints warnings instead of enforcing.
#     disabled - No SELinux policy is loaded.
SELINUX=permissive

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Adjust booleans before adding your own custom modules
texts.text: Adjust booleans before adding your own custom modules

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There are a lot of booleans you can toggle to get the functionality you need without adding your own custom SELinux modules with
texts.text: There are a lot of booleans you can toggle to get the functionality you need without adding your own custom SELinux modules with

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: . If you wanted to see all of the applicable booleans for
texts.text: . If you wanted to see all of the applicable booleans for

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# getsebool -a | grep httpd
httpd_builtin_scripting --> on
httpd_can_check_spam --> off
httpd_can_network_connect --> on
httpd_can_network_connect_cobbler --> off
httpd_can_network_connect_db --> off
httpd_can_network_memcache --> off
httpd_can_network_relay --> on
httpd_can_sendmail --> on
... and so on ...
texts.text:
# getsebool -a | grep httpd
httpd_builtin_scripting --> on
httpd_can_check_spam --> off
httpd_can_network_connect --> on
httpd_can_network_connect_cobbler --> off
httpd_can_network_connect_db --> off
httpd_can_network_memcache --> off
httpd_can_network_relay --> on
httpd_can_sendmail --> on
... and so on ...

texts.text: if you want to be specific about your setting (this is good for scripts):

texts.orig: Tracking your history of AVC denials
texts.text: Tracking your history of AVC denials

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: All of your AVC denals are logged by
texts.text: All of your AVC denals are logged by

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: but it's not the easiest file to read and parse. That's where
texts.text: but it's not the easiest file to read and parse. That's where

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# aureport --avc | tail -n 5
45. 01/24/2012 04:23:29 postdrop unconfined_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 4 fifo_file getattr system_u:object_r:postfix_public_t:s0 denied 1061
46. 01/24/2012 04:23:29 postdrop unconfined_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 2 fifo_file write system_u:object_r:postfix_public_t:s0 denied 1062
47. 01/24/2012 04:23:29 postdrop unconfined_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 2 fifo_file open system_u:object_r:postfix_public_t:s0 denied 1062
48. 01/24/2012 14:01:58 sendmail unconfined_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 160 process setrlimit unconfined_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 denied 1123
49. 01/24/2012 14:01:58 postdrop unconfined_u:system_r:httpd_t:s0 4 dir search system_u:object_r:postfix_public_t:s0 denied 1124

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There's no need to be scared of or be annoyed by SELinux in your server environment. While it takes some getting used to (and what new software doesn't?), you'll have an extra layer of security and access restrictions which should let you sleep a little better at night.
texts.text: There's no need to be scared of or be annoyed by SELinux in your server environment. While it takes some getting used to (and what new software doesn't?), you'll have an extra layer of security and access restrictions which should let you sleep a little better at night.
